articles.title: Powerball winning numbers announced for estimated $1.8 billion jackpot - CBS News
articles.description: Saturday's jackpot has an estimated cash value of $826.4 million, Powerball said.

US Open asks broadcasters to avoid crowd reactions to Trump during men’s finals match - CNN
articles.description: Whether Trump is met by jeers or cheers at Arthur Ashe Stadium on Sunday, the US Tennis Association says it wants the focus to be on the court.

articles.title: Creative Arts Emmys, Night One: Winners List (Updating Live) - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: Julianne Nicholson, Bryan Cranston, Merritt Wever and Shawn Hatosy are among the Night 1 winners for 'Hacks,' 'The Studio,' 'Severance' and 'The Pitt,' respectively.

articles.title: Lisbon funicular cable disconnected before crash — report - dw.com
articles.description: Initial findings revealed that the funiculr accident occurred within 50 seconds. Officials called the deadly crash one of Lisbon's worst tragedies in recent memory.

articles.title: Sydney Sweeney lands a knockout at TIFF with ‘Christy,’ stoking Oscar buzz - The Seattle Times
articles.description: Sydney Sweeney came to the Toronto International Film Festival wanting to talk about her film “Christy,” not her American Eagle ad campaign.

articles.title: Carlo Acutis: From London baptism to first millennial saint - BBC
articles.description: Before his death at 15, Carlo Acutis was known for his love of technology and had created a website to document miracles.

articles.title: At least 2 killed, including infant, 13 injured in Kyiv amid Russian drone, missile attacks on residential buildings - The Kyiv Independent
articles.description: Russia launched hundreds of attack drones towards Ukrainian cities overnight on Sept. 6-7, striking multiple residential buildings in Kyiv, officials reported.

articles.title: Thousands march in D.C. against Trump’s law enforcement takeover - The Washington Post
articles.description: The “We Are All D.C.” march is one of the first major organized protests since President Donald Trump deployed federal troops to the nation’s capital.

articles.title: RFK. Jr’s family members call for his resignation, say he is a ‘threat’ to Americans’ health - PBS
articles.description: Kennedy's sister, Kerry Kennedy, and his nephew, Joseph P. Kennedy III, issued scathing statements Friday, calling for him to step down as health secretary following a contentious congressional hearing this past week.

articles.title: Get Ready! The 'Blood Moon' Total Lunar Eclipse Is About to Happen - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Stargazers will have a chance to see a "Blood Moon" on Sunday night during a total lunar eclipse visible across Asia and swathes of Europe and Africa.

articles.title: South Sudan repatriates Mexican man deported from U.S. in July - CBS News
articles.description: The man, a Mexican identified as Jesus Munoz-Gutierrez, was among a group of eight who had been in South Sudan government custody since their deportation.

articles.title: ICE arrests at a Georgia Hyundai plant create new tension with South Korea - NPR
articles.description: South Korea's foreign minister is considering a trip to the U.S. to meet with the Trump administration after hundreds of South Koreans were arrested in Georgia at an electric vehicle battery plant.

articles.title: 'Godfather of AI' says the technology will create massive unemployment and send profits soaring — 'that is the capitalist system' - Fortune
articles.description: "We are at a point in history where something amazing is happening, and it may be amazingly good, and it may be amazingly bad."

articles.title: Israel destroys second high-rise as assault on Gaza City intensifies - BBC
articles.description: Israel continues to expand its military operation in Gaza, urging Palestinians to leave Gaza City and move south.

articles.description: Liftoff occurred at 2:06 p.m. EDT on Saturday (Sept. 6).
